intro: Pavetta lasiocalyx, commonly known as the rough-leaved pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its oval, leathery leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, winged seeds when mature.
